en: A personal letter from T. M. Scott in Melissa, Texas to Professor Louis L. McInnis advising him against returning to teaching and encouraging him to pursue banking opportunities instead, particularly through contact with Captain Fowlkes. Scott expresses optimism about business prospects and conveys regards from himself and his family to McInnis and his family members.

body.value:
[Header]

Melissa Texas
June 27th /90
Prof. S. S. McInnis
College Station

Dear Prof. I had heard
of the action of the Board before I re-
ceived your note to day,
I do not see how a person of
your business qualifications and at
your age, can say "I am at entire loss
to know what to do." Were I in your place
I certainly would never go to teaching
school again, but I would spurt up, see
Capt. Fowlkes and talk Bank with him,
don't be in a rush. Its my impression this
will be a fine business year and you
will be sure to light on your feet.
We are over at home, hard at work getting
clear of dirt. Don't know if we will stay, but
like Mc Cawber something may turn up. Kind
love from Telie and I to Mrs McInnis her Mother
and the little One. Very truly, Yrs & c

[Signature]

T. M. Scott.

He questions the Professor's state of mind, especially considering the Professor's "business qualifications".
